greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations s of {1,2,...,n} such that |s(i)-i| for i=1,2,...,n are all distinct.
link: H. A. Shah Ali, Problem 10964, Amer. Math. Monthly, 109 (2002), 759.
example: a(8) = 32, since the following 32 permutations of {12345678} and no others, have the required property:
results.author: Reiner Martin (reinermartin(AT)hotmail.com), Oct 15 2002
ext: Extended and edited by _John W. Layman_, Oct 05 2004
a(28) through a(31) from _Al Zimmermann_, Aug 22 2007
a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 16 2019
